metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000805 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Paramiko version 2.4.1, 2.3.2, 2.2.3, 2.1.5, 2.0.8, 1.18.5, 1.17.6 containsa Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in SSH server that can result inRCE. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-paramiko - 1.10.1-1git1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: paramiko package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.1-1git1ubuntu0.2').
